intro: Aneilema biflorum, commonly known as the two-flowered aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts, and are often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems.
